identificationModule.briefTitle: High-Resolution Lower Dose Dedicated Breast Computed Tomography (CT)
identificationModule.officialTitle: Study of High-resolution, Lower Dose Dedicated Breast CT.

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This study is being performed to find out if a new kind of breast imaging (called dedicated breast CT or BCT) can help doctors to see the small structures in breast tissue more clearly. The investigators also want to find out if using the BCT will provide a more accurate diagnosis of breast cancer.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription:
The breast imaging device that will be used in this study (breast computed tomography or BCT) is not FDA-approved for this use so this is a research study. The machine has been redesigned to see if doctors can see smaller structures and use a lower radiation dose.

The breast CT device will take multiple pictures of the subject's breast and create a 3-D image of the breast. It does not compress or squash the breast like a mammogram.

designInfo.interventionModelDescription: All subjects will undergo a bilateral breast CT (BCT) exam.

armGroups.label: Dedicated breast computed tomography (BCT)
armGroups.description: All subjects will undergo bilateral breast CT (BCT) imaging exam.

interventions.name: Dedicated breast CT(BCT)
interventions.description: The breast CT device will take multiple pictures of the subject's uncompressed breast and creates a 3-D image of the breast.

primaryOutcomes.description: The diagnostic accuracy of BCT will be determined from a multi-reader, multi-case reader study.
